thread.title: Humpback whales in Alaska surface spectacularly by boat and man films it
thread.title_full: Humpback whales in Alaska surface spectacularly by boat and man films it | Daily Mail Online

author: Katie Amey for MailOnline
title: Humpback whales in Alaska surface spectacularly by boat and man films it
text:
11 shares 2
View
comments
Seeing one whale is thrilling enough, but seeing a whole pod surface just yards away - and catching them on camera - is cause for celebration.
Or in the case of fisherman Brad Rich, uncontrollable laughter.
He was in a boat with friend Tony Flanders off the coast of Seward, Alaska, when the once-in-a-lifetime event took place.
Incredible whale display in Alaska filmed by a new star A man's day of sea fishing started out uneventfully enough - before he stumbled upon a pod of whales
His footage begins with a serene expanse of ocean and conversation about the probability of seeing the massive mammals.
'I hear them,' he declares a few moments later.
RELATED ARTICLES Previous 1 Next Passenger's fury after being charged Â£20 to retrieve his... The cat that got too close for comfort: Alarming moment... They really ARE paved with gold: From New York's Fifth... Jump right in! Stunning pictures of the ocean from above... Share this article Share 11 shares Suddenly, what looks to be about a dozen whales surface - nearly knocking over the boat in the process.
The family of whales retreat almost as quickly as they appeared, however, only showing on screen for a few seconds.
While fishing off the coast of Steward, Alaska, Brad Rich received the shock of his life when a pod of humpback whales emerged from the water
About a dozen of the massive mammals bobbed above the surface, while he filmed the encounter in disbelief
The whales came dangerously close to his friend's boat, nearly knocking it over at one point
But it was Brad's reaction to the entire incident that was truly the most entertaining of all
Upon spotting the whales, he began screaming and laughing uncontrollably- yet still continued filming
But it's Brad's reaction that's possibly the most entertaining aspect of the videol.
'Oh my God! They're right in front of us!' he screams, before breaking out in uncontrollable laughter.
Seward, Alaska, is home to the Kenai Fjords National Park, which is a popular destination for whale watching tours.
Different species of whales, from humpbacks to orcas, are known to frequent the coastal waters.
